comments:
KDE, RH 7.2, Build F2.

1. Go to a Resources Perspective.
2. Create a Project>>Simple.
3. Import the attached zip file into the project.
4. In Navigator view double click *.class file, double click *.java file, 
double click .project file.
5. Give the .project file focus (click in its text area).
6. File-->Exit.
7, Run eclipse again.  Click on the tab for the *.class file editor.

Get an "Error creating view" message.  Also got a widget disposed message while 
running through this scenario.  Log follows.  (Note that this is on Linux, I 
didn't try to recreate on Win).

Created an attachment (id=1198)
*.zip file to import
Appears to be specific to Linux.  Cannot recreate on Win2K.
Could not reproduce it on Win XP.

Seems related to lazy editor creation.
See also bug 18515 which has a similar stack to the second one here.
May be a JDT problem too, but we should check lazy editor creation first.

Lynne, were you using GTK or Motif?
The SWTException could be a dup of bug 14463 if on GTK.

Reproduced it in F2 but could not reproduce it in 607.

See comments "Grant Gayed 2002-06-04 17:10" in bug 14463.
So requestActivation() is not going to be called anymore an the NPE is not 
going to happen.

Marking as dup of bug 14463.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14463 ***
